revised_title: Designing Porous Wind Tunnels for Zero Blockage in Compressible Flow
tldr: The author develops a mathematical theory for designing wind tunnels with porous walls to achieve zero blockage in subsonic compressible flow. The theory considers both solid and wake blockage effects and suggests controlling the pressure on the outside of the porous wall to eliminate interference caused by wind tunnel walls. The author also discusses the advantages of porous-walled tunnels over conventional tunnels in transonic flow regimes.
